answers.answer: What's the difference in the wks of ur lmp and ur US?
A week really doesn't make a huge difference in healthy pregnancy.  If you other complications though like diabetes or preeclampsia there can be issues.

The preeclampsia came after my due date and I was fine until then, my gut says stick to original due date which would be March 2nd, doctor said March 9th... Might not seem like a big deal but I have high anxiety about latten complications.
And idk what most abbreviations for preggo lingo are so you'll have to translate for me lol

Last menstral  period and ultrasound date  lol.  I would be trying to induce naturally but I really do not think they would put you in danger just let her know your concerns maybe she can help consol you

question: Doctor changed my due date a week later at first ultrasound, she did this with my first born as well and that extra time in pregnancy brought on preeclampsia and a near death experience losing 40% of my blood, this was nine years ago. I'm now 28 and want to suggest going with the date given based on my last period. She said due to complications she wouldn't let me go passed my due date but I want that to be the original one. Will a week at full term make that much of a difference for baby? When I'm closer I'm going to push myself to go into labor naturally but in case this ones as stubborn as the first... Appointment Friday and would love some input for how to approach my doctor about this.
title: When to induce...
